creditline: Bequest of Virginia Doneghy, by exchange
description: rectangular lidded woven box; cover has light tone at center with two rows of purple stripes bordering wide variegated green-brown stripes at each end; box sides have central tan and brown stripe, flanked by variegated green-brown stripes and thin purple stripes; bottom of box has light tone; loose certification tag with artist's signature inside box
markings: loose tag inside box: certification tag of Art of the Maine Wabanaki with artist\'s signature in gold
medium: Black ash, cedar bark, sweetgrass, blueberry dye
text: Penobscot baskets are known for their fine and elegant weave and their subtle colors. Using berry-dyed black ash, sweetgrass, and split cedar bark, Theresa Secord's carefully created Glove Box is an excellent example of basketry from the northeastern region of the United States.
title: Glove Box
